project.teaser: As climatic conditions are constantly changing and the frequency of extreme events increases, there is an urgency of planning, designing and retrofitting the built environment in order adapt it to present and future risks. Too frequently the built environment is a driver of...
project.objective: As climatic conditions are constantly changing and the frequency of extreme events increases, there is an urgency of planning, designing and retrofitting the built environment in order adapt it to present and future risks. Too frequently the built environment is a driver of vulnerability, rather than being a shelter for citizens. For this reason, mitigation and adaptation need to be pursued actively, putting built environment and human resilience at the center of a climate and future-proofing action. The MULTICLIMACT project aims to develop a mainstreamed framework and a tool for supporting public stakeholders and citizens to assess the resilience of the built environment and its people at multiple scales (buildings, urban areas, territories) against locally relevant natural and climatic hazards and supply-chains, as well as to support them to enhance their preparedness and responsiveness across their life cycle. The mainstreamed approach will include a method specifically targeted for including several types of built environment assets, including human well-being, health, and quality of life as an essential scale of analysis and action. MULTICLIMACT will support resilience-enabling ACTions by implementing a toolkit of 18 reliable, easy-to-implement and cost-effective Design methods, Materials, and Digital Solutions, enabling users to easily estimate the impact of their implementation on the resilience of the targeted asset, integrating a multidisciplinary approach integrating socio-economic, life, engineering, and climate disciplines. The MULTICLIMACT approach is integrated with relevant international and European initiatives, building upon existing knowledge and instruments, and demonstrating the proposed approach in four case studies that represent various geographical location, natural and climatic hazards, social and economic systems and scales of analysis, ranging from single buildings (including cultural heritage) to the urban and territorial scales.
project.title: MULTI-faceted CLIMate adaptation ACTions to improve resilience, preparedness and responsiveness of the built environment against multiple hazards at multiple scales
project.keywords: built environment resilience, human-centered approach, resilience-enabling materials, life cycle approach, protective digital solutions

result.title: MULTICLIMACT toolkit assessment framework
result.description: Report on design practices and methods, digital solutions and association of indicators with materials and technologies, for the impact assessment of MULTICLIMACT toolkit

result.title: Planning and designing resilience-enabling interventions in cultural heritage buildings, urban and rural contexts
result.description: A multi-scale approach to design resilience-enabling interventions on CH will be adopted, followed targeted impact assessment, and aiming at their preservation.

result.title: MULTICLIMACT CREMA tool planning and design
result.description: Development of the MULTICLIMACT resilience framework to provide support to decision-makers in evaluating resilience-enabling measures and interventions.

result.title: Review, design and specifications of Fiber optic-based monitoring systems for flood defences
result.description: Determination of the applicability and implementations feasibility of spatially distributed fiber sensing for flood defences.

result.title: Design of a common, high-level standardized architecture for MULTICLIMACT digital solutions
result.description: Development of a common, high-level standardized architecture for the digital solutions & the interoperability among them.

result.title: Design of a digital solution for the multi-purpose monitoring of environmental and structural behaviour of buildings
result.description: Further design of the BIM-based platform, integrating digital tools standards and sensors data from relevant building, aiming at assets structural health monitoring and assessment.

result.title: Review, design and specifications of new pavement cooling materials and Nature-based solutions for improving the resilience in urban spaces
result.description: Development of innovative materials and technologies for protecting urban environments towards heat island effects and urban floods.

result.title: European and International outreach and cooperation plan
result.description: Mapping of existing similar projects and relevant initiatives, actions for evaluating the outcomes impact and projects spreading.

result.title: Planning and designing adaptation policies and measures for enabling a climate-proof built environment at different scales
result.description: Description to the public decision maker of appropriate-to-adopt methods under specific criteria and applicability context, regarding the climate-proofing of built environment.

result.title: Design of a digital solution for monitoring and early-warning of flood defence systems during flood and drought episodes
result.description: Design of a fiber-based monitoring system for providing remote update on the performance of flood defense systems during floods and droughts, and punctual EWS.

result.title: Integration of Railway Bridge Structural Health Monitoring into the Internet of Things with a Digital Twin: A Case Study
Design of a digital solution for climate-proof characterisation of thermal and energy solutions
result.description: Design in initial level of tools for modelling the interventions performance towards their thermal and energy performance.

result.title: Design of a digital solution for the prevention and damage estimation of natural extreme events consequence at different scales
result.description: Overall design of the CIP-Cast platform, including feature for resilience analyses, the integration of a GIS platform, hazard and vulnerability models in territorial scale.

result.title: Design of a digital solution for climate-proofing urban energy planning
result.description: Improvement of GIS-based planning tool for addressing heating, cooling and electricity decarbonized future scenarios at urban level.

result.title: Design and planning methods for new and retrofitted buildings focussing on citizens’ health and well-being
result.description: Based on KPIs related to people and improvement of design processes for new and retrofitted buildings, solutions will focus on supporting peoples health and well-being.

result.title: Design and planning methods for supporting the built environment resilience by accurately accounting for supply chains
result.description: Enhancement of the resilience in the supply chain sector via specific methods, and by ensuring its operational ability and contribution to the built environment.

result.title: Planning and designing resilient housing: energy retrofit interventions that will contribute to the climate-proofing of the built environment at multiple scales
result.description: Provision and implementation of best practices for housing, in favour of built environments goals for energy consumption reduction and the climate adaptation as main component of the design philosophy.

result.title: MULTICLIMACT resilience scorecard method
result.description: This is a report on the development of a qualitative and quantitative resilience methods at different scales (occupant, building, territorial) and for different dimensions (technical, social, economic).

result.title: Review, design and specifications of cutting-edge, evolutive, self-sensing and multi-functional materials and technologies for improving the resilience of buildings, including cultural heritage.
result.description: Design of innovative materials and technologies for improving the resilience and the climate adaptation of buildings, including cultural heritage.

result.title: LCC, LCA and sLCA for supporting the planning and design of resilience-enabling interventions on the built environment at multiple scales
result.description: Implementation of a life-cycle approach in different sectors, by considering economic values and social aspects, in favour of actions enhancing the build environment resilience.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - MULTICLIMACT (MULTI-faceted CLIMate adaptation ACTions to improve resilience, preparedness and responsiveness of the built environment against multiple hazards at multiple scales)
result.teaser: The MULTICLIMACT project addresses climate change and natural hazards impacting the built environment. Involving 25 institutions across Europe, it combines engineering, environmental, and social sciences to develop practical solutions for urban resilience and sustainability...
result.description: periodic

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

category.title: natural disasters
category.displayCode: /natural sciences/earth and related environmental sciences/physical geography/natural disasters

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
